info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 1:46PM EDT until August 22 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Calhoun and Orangeburg.
* WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Rises in small streams. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 145 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elloree, Santee State Park, Santee, Cameron and Poplar Creek Landing. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 95 and 99. Interstate 26 between mile markers 153 and 156. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don't drown.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
